basics.name: Michael Graves
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am an undergraduate student studying Computer Science at The University of Texas at Dallas

courses: C/C++ Programming in a UNIX Environment

work.summary: Worked as a developer for the OIT at UT Dallas
highlights: Assisted with administrating the school’s AWS environment by developing and documenting Python and Powershell scripts for billing, maintenance, and managing user access management.
Worked with senior engineers to develop processes and templates for deploying cloud resources to EC2 instances with AWS Cloud Formation in an agile and scrum based environment.
Programmed with Python, Node.js, PowerShell, and YAML, as well as assisted with moving on-premise disaster recovery database and application servers to the cloud.
Created containers in AWS Elastic Container Service using Docker, Rancher, and Kubernetes in order to assist fellow developers in transitioning to containerization based application development.
Created and curated data based charts and spreadsheets that were easily consumable to present to senior executives for workload progress and success.

volunteer.organization: Visa x Codepath Internship Prep Workshop
volunteer.summary: In 12-weeks, I will gain a preview of real-world software topics and be prepared to solve challenging algorithmic problems in whiteboard and coding interviews. Over the course of the summer, I will attend lectures, labs, and info sessions, plus receive feedback on my resume.

The Capital One First-Gen Focus program supports and helps 1st year first-generation college students create pathways for a sustainable financial future through free resources revolving around three core program pillars: Financial Well-Being, Personal Wellness, and Career Readiness & Persistence
The ACM Mentor/Mentee program paired me with a mentor where I learned about contributing to the ACM's Project Nebula codebase and tips for succeeding in college over the spring 2022 semester.
Transcribing and proofreading pages from books to be released to the public domain.

awards.title: Haraldson Foundation Scholarship
awards.summary: A prestigious scholarship given to students who graduate within the Top 10% of their graduation class, hold High SAT or ACT scores, demonstrate exceptional character and leadership, and participate in community service within their community.
